definition: lit. source is distant and the flow is long (idiom); fig. sth goes back to the dim and distant past/a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Both Asia and Europe are cradles of human civilizations and have long been associated with each other.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲和歐洲都是人類文明的搖籃，相互交往源遠流長。

sentences.english: Wunquan town of Kaixian county has a long history of well salt production.
sentences.chinese: 開縣溫泉鎮井鹽生產歷史悠久，源遠流長。

sentences.english: Each of the above-mentioned two aspects has its developing clue.
sentences.chinese: 上述兩個維面，各有其源遠流長的承傳發展線索。

sentences.english: Rationalistic tradition had been from Ancient Greek in western philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 理性主義傳統在西方可謂源遠流長。

sentences.english: In Hunan, products abound and economic trade has had a long history.
sentences.chinese: 湖南物產豐富，經濟貿易源遠流長。

sentences.english: Raymond Li, Jinwei expressed China and Canada good relationship of long standing, expect to recover that day.
sentences.chinese: 李錦維表示加中良好關係源遠流長，期待恢復這一天。

sentences.english: The China-India friendship has a time-honored history which can date back to 2,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 中印友誼源遠流長，可以追溯到兩千年前。

sentences.english: Li Zhaoxing said that China-Nepal relations are ever lasting.
sentences.chinese: 李肇星說，中尼友好關係源遠流長。

sentences.english: Hu Jintao said that the people of China and Myanmar have enjoyed long-standing friendship.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤說，中緬兩國人民的友誼源遠流長。

sentences.english: The two peoples enjoy a long history of exchanges and friendship.
sentences.chinese: 中德兩國人民的交往和友誼源遠流長。

sentences.english: His Art of War has been passed down to this day. Qilu culture has a long history.
sentences.chinese: 《孫子兵法》流傳至今，齊魯文化源遠流長。

sentences.english: Formal interpretation boasts a long history and profound impact on legal system.
sentences.chinese: 正式解釋源遠流長，在法制史上影響深遠。

sentences.english: The area has a long tradition of horticulture.
sentences.chinese: 園藝是這個地區源遠流長的傳統。

sentences.english: The mechanism of "Faculty-dominant" has a long history as the universities of western countries.
sentences.chinese: 教授治校的管理機制與西方大學一樣源遠流長。

sentences.english: Punning in Chinese has a long history, though it is of uncertain origin.
sentences.chinese: 漢語雙關名稱來源不詳，但其使用源遠流長。

sentences.english: Foot massage goes back to ancient times. It's a gem of the treasure-house of the traditional Chinese medical science.
sentences.chinese: 足部按摩源遠流長，爲中國傳統中醫學寶庫中的瑰寶。

definition: traceable to the same stock (idiom); of a common origin (of trends, ideas etc)
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
descendants of the Fiery Emperor and the Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
